idea:
We have designed a Simple Electro-pneumatic ventilator that can be used for Covid-19. The ventilator has a microprocessor controller with pressure & flow Sensors and a pneumatic block which can drive the ventilation and has a venturi System for mixing Air from Ambient environment.

The product has one mode of operation which is Continuous Mandatory Ventilation Commonly known as CMV. In product you can select the flow to be given to the patient and the delivered flow is displayed on the LCD screen using a Flow sensor. Breath per minute can be set. There is an inbuilt pressure regulator which can limit the pressure going to the patient. We also have a pressure sensor which allows setting pressure limit, so as safety feature, if the pressure exceeds then the pressure relief valve will open and excessive pressure will be released.

We have designed a breathing valve which has options of adding Mechanical Peep valve to deliver desired peep to the patient.

The basic ventilator design has been completed and tested. We are now preparing to start commercial production of the same.
name: MEDIFAB ENGINEERING LLP

idea:
Hitech Ultraviolet has been in the industry since 1984. An ISO registered company, certified with the Uv system listing conforming to European Economic Area. It is a member of the Water Quality Association (USA) and of the Indian Water Works. Hitech UV has been manufacturing and exporting a complete range of UV Water Disinfection Systems (UV System), UV Air Sterilizer, Water Submersible UV Sterilizer, UV Surface Purifiers, UV Room Sterilizers & Micron Filters.

Through our journey of more than three decades, we have served 60,000 plus customers in more than 39 countries. Currently, Hitech UV products are contributing to the disinfection & sterilization process of water, air & surface in diverse industries like Hospitals, Pharmaceuticals, Food & Beverages, Hospitality, Dairy, Paint, Automobile (Paint shop) etc.

name: LIFE QUEST EDUTECH PRIVATE LIMITED

idea:
With the mission to improve social care received by elderly, vulnerable and self-isolating adults and children, EAI Systems developed ReportMyCare App.

This app will empower citizens needing care and their next-of-kin to report on the quality of care in real-time.

Our market research found that most Government agencies and Government departments did not have access to a reliable and responsive tool to monitor social care contemporaneously. 

Citizens in care could not feedback about the care received. For example, as a daughter of somebody who needs social care, you may not know where complaints go, if they are logged at all and who would follow up with. 

ReportMyCare App addresses these problems by empowering the citizen by providing real-time assessment of care. 

We aim to work with Government agencies and departments, social care providers to help feedback on care in real-time so they can monitor and improve the quality of care rapidly.
name: Rakesh Nair
